description: Formal connector used to add supplementary information. More formal than 'de plus', commonly found in academic and professional writing.
usage: Typically at the beginning of a sentence in formal texts to introduce additional arguments or information. Rare in casual conversation.

examples.french: Ce projet est innovant. En outre, il est économiquement viable.
examples.english: This project is innovative. Furthermore, it is economically viable.

examples.french: Le candidat a de l'expérience. En outre, il parle trois langues.
examples.english: The candidate has experience. Moreover, he speaks three languages.

examples.french: Cette méthode est efficace. En outre, elle est facile à appliquer.
examples.english: This method is effective. In addition, it's easy to apply.

notes: Very formal. Use 'de plus' in conversation. Essential for academic writing and formal reports.
